context.p: installationservice startlaunch the Data Collectorservice startInstalling the full as a service requires sudo privileges on the root directory.
This procedure walks through setting the default directories, but you can alternatively use the <SDCinstalldir>/libexec/sdcd-env.sh script.

step.cmd: Download the StreamSets SDC tarball and extract it to the desired location, typically /opt/local/.
Copy initd/_sdcinitd_prototype to the /etc/init.d/ directory as sdc.
Edit the sdc file and set the SDC_DIST and SDC_HOME environment variable to the location where you extracted the SDC tarball.
Use the following command to make the sdc file executable:
Create a system user and group to run the .
step.info: The default user and group are sdc/sdc.

step.cmd: Create the /etc/sdc directory and copy all files from etc into this directory.
Create the SDC log directory at /var/log/sdc and change the owner to sdc:sdc.
Create the SDC data directory at /var/lib/sdc and change the owner to sdc:sdc.
Create the SDC data directory at /var/lib/sdc-resources and change the owner to sdc:sdc.
To start the as a service, use the following command:

info.p: For CentOS, use the following command:$ chkconfig --add sdc
For Ubuntu, use the following command:$ update-rc.d sdc defaults 97 03
